intro: Shorea dispar, commonly known as the white ironwood, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Dipterocarpaceae and is characterized by its heavy, durable wood that is highly valued in the timber industry. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and can reach heights of up to 40 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinctive dark green color on the upper surface. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers and is often associated with other dipterocarps in mixed forest ecosystems.
